title: inadequate records kept 700m worth
story: Inadequate records kept of £m worth of Covid deals for firm linked to Tory MPThe NAO found ministers attended eight meetings with testing firm Randox - twice as many as previously disclosed - but kept minutes for just two Image: PAByMikey SmithWhitehall Correspondent:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsThe Government kept inadequate records of negotiations towards more than £m worth of Covid contracts handed to a firm linked to a Tory MP, an official probe has found. Ministers attended eight meetings with testing firm Randox - twice as many as previously disclosed - but kept minutes for just two, according to the National Audit Office’s investigation. The firm and its strategic partner Qnostics Ltd were handed £. million with of contracts - % of which were awarded without competition under emergency procurement rules. The firm had former Tory MP Owen Paterson on their payroll as a consultant.And documents released last month revealed he had personally lobbied then-Health Secretary Matt Hancock for the firm - and asking him to kill news stories making claims about his involvement with the initial £m deal.Before the NAO’s report today, the government had admitted to four ministerial meetings with Randox since the start of the pandemic.  But the NAO identied a further four where the Department of Health and Social Carehad failed to record Randox’s attendance on official transparency releases. They also found documents which “indicated” one-to-one telephone calls between ministers - including Mr Hancock and former le sciences minister Lord Bethell - and representatives of Randox, including Mr Paterson.  DHSC could not confirm to the NAO whether the calls took place, or any notes from the discussions. Gareth Davies, head of the NAO, said: Even taking these exceptional circumstances into account, the documentation of the decision-making process for such large contracts was inadequate.”  Meg Hillier, chair of the Public Accounts Committee added: Government grasped the urgent need to increase the scale of testing early in the pandemic. But while it was fast on procurement, it was fast and loose on process. While the body found no evidence contracts were handed out improperly, the gaps in records meant they were not able to provide positive assurance in the normal way.” The report read: “This report should not be considered as offering positive assurance over any of these contracts which are not detailed in the report or as offering any legal opinion on the use of public procurement regulations.” Despite this, Mr Hancock claimed the report had given ministers a “clean bill of health”, adding “the report found no evidence of wrongdoing because there was no wrongdoing.”The report noted Mr Hancock had used private email and WhatsApp to discuss Randox with Mr Paterson.He did not disclose all the messages to DHSC officials at the time, telling investigators he did not believe they were “substantive” discussions, and he was not required to do so under Cabinet Office rules. He later made his phone available to investigators and to the department.The report also notes the Information Commissioner is investigating the use of private correspondence channels at DHSC, but has yet to publish its report. DHSC was “unable to provide” key evidence to investigators about decision making - and because notes were not recorded in the department’s existing systems, they had to search several officials’ email accounts to find it. “The Department gave us incomplete or no documentation on other signicant aspects of the procurement,” the report reads. “Including detailed due diligence, detailed contractual negotiations leading to the first contact award, and considering of potential conflicts of interest.” Records seen by the NAO suggest officials did not think conflicts of interest rules applied to emergency direct awards. “This reflects an incorrect understanding of the relevant regulations,” the report reads. A spokesperson for Mr Hancock said: “Mr Hancock warmly welcomes this thorough report by the NAO, which confirms a total clean bill of health on Ministers’ work with Randox during the pandemic. The report found no evidence of wrongdoing because there was no wrongdoing - just lots of hard work to expand testing capacity. While the department will no doubt reflect on the technical issues that need to be addressed, the report sets out that Ministers and Officials in the Department were doing their very best to save lives in what was a quick moving and unprecedented situation. Mr Hancockaposs thoughts remain with the victims and their loved ones.  Ms Hillier, chair of the Public Accounts Committee, said: “Government grasped the urgent need to increase the scale of testing early in the pandemic. But while it was fast on procurement, it was fast and loose on process. “The Randox contracts illustrate that proper transparency by government is vital. Government didn’t document decisions properly and the public is right to raise questions about whether it was playing with a straight bat. “Over % of testing contracts were awarded to ‘high priority’ companies, including those referred by ministers, MPs or Number . The public needs to trust that their taxes are spent on the basis that it’s what you know, not who you know. “As with many of the COVID response schemes, lessons must be learned about delivering at speed.” A spokesperson for Randox said: “We welcome the finding of the NAO report that there is no evidence of any impropriety in the awarding of government contracts to Randox. “This independent finding vindicates what both Randox and the Government have always said, that these contracts were awarded on merit and in keeping with government protocols and regulations at a time of acute national emergency. “During the pandemic, Randox delivered more than  million gold standard PCR tests, becoming the first laboratory in the world to process more than , tests daily. “In doing so, Randox played its part in helping save tens of thousands of lives, keeping vital sectors of the economy open and enabling essential overseas family and business travel. “The report states that four ministerial meetings took place which were, apparently, not fully documented by the DHSC. “While we cannot comment on government minuting of meetings, Randox can categorically state that the awarding of contracts was not on the agenda at any of these meetings.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON WhatsAppNational Audit OfficeLord BethellGareth DaviesOwen PatersonBoris JohnsonMeg HillierPoliticsSolar powerCoronavirus" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily health briefing with all the news you need to know direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: lack support poor sunaks mini
story: Lack of support for poor in Sunaks mini budget is indefensible amid costs crisisTorsten Bell, chief executive of the Resolution Foundation, writes in the Mirror on Chancellor Rishi Sunaks badly designed mini budget policy package with an indefensible lack of support for the poorest households with incredibly dficult times aheadopinionByTorsten Bell:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments It’s hard to overstate the scale of the cost of living crisis that’s coming. The highest inflation in  years and the worst income squeeze on record lie ahead of us.While household finances are taking a hammering, the public finances have actually been on the up: we’re all paying more taxes than the Government expected. Using that headroom, the Chancellor today prioritised rebuilding his tax cutting credentials over support for the low-to-middle income households hardest hit. A p cut to fuel duty will save the typical driving households £ a year, but only reverse  per cent of the increase in pump prices over the past year.Do you agree  Have your say in the comment section An increase in how much you can earn before you start paying National Insurance will be welcome relief for many, but middle and top income households will gain the most. In fact only £ in every £ of new support goes to the poorer half of families. Giving councils £m to provide emergency support to people struggling just isn’t enough when benefits will fall £bn next year in real terms. Absolute poverty will rise. Get the stories you want straight to your inbox.toone of the Mirroraposs newslettersPromising an Income Tax cut for  also can’t hide the fact that taxes are going up not down. Tax receipts as a share of the economy are set to reach their highest level since - – we’re talking the equivalent of a £, rise per household since the  election. Today the Chancellor announced a bigger policy package than expected, but it was badly designed. With UK inflation soaring to .% - its fastest rise in  years - millions of households will be worrying about their own finances. The  cost of living crisis is hitting energy prices, fuel and the cost of food, with the governmentaposs only solution so far to offer all households a £ loan to help pay off their energy bills - which must be paid back eventually. Chancellor Rishi Sunakaposs Spring Statement saw him announce a cut in fuel duty, although this will cost the Treasury billions without putting cash back in familiesapos pockets. So how will the Spring Statement affect you The  huge big cost of living blows hitting you from next Friday What the fuel duty cut actually means - and whether weaposll see the dference in our pockets The Spring Statement  summaryaposs key announcements Everything you need to know about the National Insurance cut The UKaposs current inflation rate amid the Spring Statement - as Brits are left with crippling costsKeep up with live announcements from the Statement in the Mirroraposs live blogIf you need help with the cost of living crisis, weaposve put together a list of charities and schemes offering advice and grants to keep you and your family warm and fed this year. Cutting Income Taxwhile raising National Insurancemakes no sense - st Century Britain is already doing enough to hurt workers and help landlords. And almost no new support for the poorest households is indefensible, when we all know that incredibly dficult times lie ahead. news politics mini-budget-leaves-working-people-"Spring Statement: Chancellor living in Sunakland says ReevesopinionByRachel Reeves:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsThe Chancellor hasn’t got a clue. Families are facing a devastating a cost of living crisis. And the Chancellor could have helped them out, by scrapping his tax rise on jobs.He could have introduced a windfall tax on oil and gas companies to cut household energy bills. He could have finally brought forward a plan to support British business and create good jobs. That’s what a Labour Government would have delivered. But instead, years of Tory tax rises means that after today the OBR say that we will still have the highest tax burden in  years. Not only that, April will now bring the biggest fall in family incomes since records began.Do you agree  Have your say in the comment section Even with the Chancellor’s cynical changes, he’s only shaving £ off every £ he’s taxing people. This simply isn’t going to cut it as inflation spirals out of control. Britain’s people needs a government on their side. Instead, we have one that wants to raise taxes and leave working people paying the price. Come April, a landlord with a large number of properties or someone who makes huge sums from buying and selling stocks and shares won’t be paying any more in tax, but their tenants will. Get the stories you want straight to your inbox.toone of the Mirroraposs newslettersWhy does the Chancellor repeatedly feel the need to raise taxes on working people, when no other major economy is doing so  Conservative governments’ failure to get our economy growing over the past  years means less revenue going into the Exchequer. And in the past two years, they have wasted taxpayers’ money – throwing it around like confetti, handing out covid loans to fraudsters which will never be repaid and wasting billions on unusable PPE. With UK inflation soaring to .% - its fastest rise in  years - millions of households will be worrying about their own finances. The  cost of living crisis is hitting energy prices, fuel and the cost of food, with the governmentaposs only solution so far to offer all households a £ loan to help pay off their energy bills - which must be paid back eventually. Chancellor Rishi Sunakaposs Spring Statement saw him announce a cut in fuel duty, although this will cost the Treasury billions without putting cash back in familiesapos pockets. So how will the Spring Statement affect you The  huge big cost of living blows hitting you from next Friday What the fuel duty cut actually means - and whether weaposll see the dference in our pockets The Spring Statement  summaryaposs key announcements Everything you need to know about the National Insurance cut The UKaposs current inflation rate amid the Spring Statement - as Brits are left with crippling costsKeep up with live announcements from the Statement in the Mirroraposs live blogIf you need help with the cost of living crisis, weaposve put together a list of charities and schemes offering advice and grants to keep you and your family warm and fed this year. The Conservatives are the party of high taxes, because they are the party of low growth and wasteful spending. The promise of crumbs in two years’ time will be of little comfort to families struggling to pay the bills today. It is timed to suit the Tory party’s interests, not the national interest. Working families and businesses are set to endure greater hardship because of the choices Rishi Sunak has made. title: no big british defence project
story: Exclusive: No big British defence project is on time and on budget, as PM heads to NATOA study by Whitehall spending watchdog the National Audit Office has revealed none of the Ministry of Defences programmes in the £.bn Major Projects Portfolio has the coveted "green" ratingBoris Johnson heads to NATO in Brussels for crunch Ukraine talks on Thursday Image: REUTERSByBen GlazeDeputy Political Editor:,  Mar |comments Not a single, major Ministry of Defence project is expected to be delivered both on time and budget, in a blow to Boris Johnson as he holds crunch Ukraine talks with NATO leaders tomorrow.An annual study of big-spending schemes reveals the likelihood of programmes being completed on schedule and in line with estimated costs. The MoD has  entries in the Government Major Projects Portfolio, with “total whole-le” costs of £.billion, according to the National Audit Office. Worryingly, two of the projects are categorised as red, meaning “successful delivery of the project appears to be unachievable.Get a daily morning politics briefing straight to your inbox.for the free Mirror Politics newsletter “There are major issues with project definition, schedule, budget, quality and or benefits delivery, which at this stage do not appear to be manageable or resolvable.  “The project may need re-scoping and or its overall viability reassessed.” One programme rated red is the vital Crowsnest radar system to be fitted to Royal Navy Merlin helicopters protecting the aircraft carrier strike groups. It is meant to provide “organic airborne surveillance and control capability”.  The other is the £.bn Armoured Cavalry programme for  Ajax fighting vehicles. Just  have been delivered and they have given troops hearing problems. Shadow Defence Secretary John Healey said: “As NATO leaders meet to respond to Russian aggression, ministers are failing to equip our armed forces with the full kit and equipment to fight and fulfil our NATO obligations.“The Ministry of Defence is a uniquely failing department with no major programme set for delivery on time and on budget, while at least £bn has also been wasted in taxpayers’ money since .“On day one, Labour in government would get the NAO to do an across-the-board audit of MoD waste and make the MoD the first department subject to our new Office for Value of Money’s tough regime on spending decisions.” Projects in the NAO’s -page “Departmental Overview of the Ministry of Defence”, published last month, have come under fresh scrutiny amid Russia ’s war with Ukraine.Vladimir Putin ’s invasion has triggered tomorrowaposs emergency summit at NATO headquarters in Brussels, where the Prime Minister is expected to welcome new defence spending pledges by allies - and urge counterparts to go further in supporting Kyiv.But details uncovered by Labour reveal the extent to which Mr Johnson should be worried about defence procurement at home. Multibillion-pound deals are rated in one of five colour-coded categories.  According to Whitehall’s Infrastructure and Projects Authority, green means “successful delivery of the project on time, budget and quality appears highly likely and there are no major outstanding issues that at this stage appear to threaten delivery signicantly”. But that does not apply to any of the MoD’s schemes. Twelve are given the amber red rating, meaning “successful delivery of the project is in doubt, with major risks or issues apparent in a number of key areas. “Urgent action is needed to address these problems and or assess whether resolution is feasible.” Fourteen are rated amber, meaning “successful delivery appears feasible but signicant issues already exist, requiring management attention. “These appear resolvable at this stage and,addressed promptly, should not present a cost schedule overrun.” An MoD spokesman said: “Our latest available figures show the majority of MoD’s major projects are capable of being delivered on time and in budget. “We are making the largest investment in our armed forces since the end of the Cold War, with an additional £bn helping ensure they have the equipment they need to meet future threats.” It is understood the most up-to-date figures show % of the MoD’s Government Major Projects Portfolio are rated as amber or better, with problems that,addressed promptly, should not trigger extra costs or delays. news politics poor-pay-price-again-sunaks-"Spring Statement: Rishi Sunaks announcements explainedopinionByVoice of the Mirror:,  Mar |commentsRishi Sunak delivered his Spring Statement today against a backdrop of darkening economic skies. Families across the country are worried about rising food and fuel costs, soaring inflation and rocketing energy bills. A bold Chancellor would have seized this opportunity to deliver a new economic deal for the British people. Instead we got some tinkering with the tax system and a promise of more support further down the line. When families needed shelter from the economic downpour, the Chancellor offered the equivalent of raising a cocktail umbrella in the middle of a hurricane. Almost all the indicators on the economic dashboard are flashing red.Do you agree  Have your say in the comment section Growth forecasts have been slashed, inflation is set to rise to a -year high and the country is set for the biggest fall in living standards since . What support Mr Sunak did provide was either too paltry to make a signicant dference, such as the cut in fuel duty, or a piece of fiscal sleight of hand. Nothing The raising of the National Insurance threshold and the promised cut in income tax will not compensate for the tax hikes coming into force next month. Overall, the tax burden is set to rise to its highest level since the Second World War. Mr Sunak’s claim to be a low-tax Chancellor is as absurd as his claim he was “standing by” families during the cost-of-living crisis. Get the stories you want straight to your inbox.toone of the Mirroraposs newslettersThere was no extra support to help people with energy bills even though they are set to increase by £, on average by this autumn. And there was nothing to help pensioners, the very low-paid and those on social security. Mr Sunak is condemning more people to poverty and more people to choose between heating and eating. Despite Conservative claims that the age of austerity is over, our public services will now receive less funding than originally announced. There will be less money for health, for schools, councils, and the armed forces. People looked to the Chancellor yesterday for help and reassurance. He delivered a financial statement that leaves only anxiety and trepidation. title: roughly 13m brits thousands kids
story: .MILLION Brits set to be dragged into absolute poverty in Spring Statement disasterThe Resolution Foundation think tank said the typical working age household will see their real income fall % next year, casting millions into absolute poverty including , kidsAmong those to fall into absolute poverty next year will be half a million children, says the think tank Image: Getty Images iStockphotoByDan BloomOnline Political Editor:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments.milion Brits including half a million children will be dragged below the poverty line despite Rishi Sunak‘s Spring Statement, devastating analysis says. A typical working-age household will see their real income fall % next year - a loss of £,, the Resolution Foundation think tank said. Absolute poverty - rather than relative poverty - is crucial because it is the measure Boris Johnson chooses to use.In  the PM controversially boasted poverty had fallen when relative poverty was up and absolute poverty was down. It comes after the Budget watchdog said soaring inflation - expected to nudge % in a four-decade high - will inflict the biggest disposable income drop since records began in the s. And today the Foundation warned poorer Brits will be hit harder as the Tory Chancellor refused to raise benefits - which will rise at less than half inflation. Meanwhile his £bn in cuts to National Insurance and fuel duty will mostly benefit people in work.Even with a p cut in income tax from , seven out of eight workers will still be paying more tax overall by , the overnight analysis found.The experts said: “The scale and distribution of the cost of living squeeze, coupled with the lack of support for low-income families, means that a further . million people are set to fall into absolute poverty next year, including , children – the first time Britain has seen such a rise outside of recessions.” With UK inflation soaring to .% - its fastest rise in  years - millions of households will be worrying about their own finances. The  cost of living crisis is hitting energy prices, fuel and the cost of food, with the governmentaposs only solution so far to offer all households a £ loan to help pay off their energy bills - which must be paid back eventually. Chancellor Rishi Sunakaposs Spring Statement saw him announce a cut in fuel duty, although this will cost the Treasury billions without putting cash back in familiesapos pockets. So how will the Spring Statement affect you The  huge big cost of living blows hitting you from next Friday What the fuel duty cut actually means - and whether weaposll see the dference in our pockets The Spring Statement  summaryaposs key announcements Everything you need to know about the National Insurance cut The UKaposs current inflation rate amid the Spring Statement - as Brits are left with crippling costsKeep up with live announcements from the Statement in the Mirroraposs live blogIf you need help with the cost of living crisis, weaposve put together a list of charities and schemes offering advice and grants to keep you and your family warm and fed this year. Despite the tax cuts yesterday, the think tank said only those earning between £, and £, will actually pay less income tax in -. And only those earning between £, and £, will pay less tax and National Insurance . Of the  million people in work, around  millionwill pay more in income tax and NI in -, the think tank said. By  earnings will be £, behind what they would have beenthey had continued growing on the pre- path.  Torsten Bell, Chief Executive of the Resolution Foundation, said: “In the face of a cost of living crisis that looks set to make this Parliament the worst on record for household incomes, the Chancellor came to the dispatch box yesterday promising support with the cost of living today, and tax cuts tomorrow. Signicant measures were announced on both counts, but the big picture is that policy does not measure up to the rhetoric. “The decision not to target support at those hardest hit by rising prices will leave low-and-middle income households painfully exposed, with . million people, including half a million children, set to fall below the poverty line this coming year. “And despite the eye-catching p cut to income tax, the reality is that the Chancellor’s tax changes mean that seven-in-eight workers will see their tax bills rise. Those tax rises mean the Chancellor is able to point to a swt fiscal consolidation and signicant headroom against his fiscal rules. “The big picture is that Rishi Sunak has prioritised rebuilding his tax-cutting credentials over supporting the low-to-middle income households who will be hardest hit from the surging cost of living, while also leaving himself fiscal flexibility in the years ahead. Whether that will be sustainable in the face of huge income falls to come remains to be seen.”  Office for Budget Responsibility watchdog chairman Richard Hughes said despite the measures announced by Rishi Sunak, people still face an unprecedented fall in living standards. He told BBC Radio aposs Today programme: So in total, they amount to about an £ billion giveaway in this spring statement coming from the Chancellor. That offsets around a third of the overall hit to living standards that people would otherwise have felt had he not taken those measures, so without the Chancellor taking action, people would have felt a % fall in their living standards in the coming  months. That reduces it down to around %, but itaposs still an unprecedented fall in peopleaposs standard of living over the next  months. Mr Hughes also said energy bills are doubling over the course of the year, rising by around % in April and another % in October. news politics squirming-rishi-sunak-confronted-hard-"Rishi Sunak confronted by LBC caller on Spring statementByRachel WearmouthSenior Political Correspondent:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsRishi Sunak cringed as he was confronted by a mum struggling with rising energy bills who told the Chancellor her home was so cold you can see our breaths. The top Tory took calls from listeners at LBC on Wednesday after unveiling his Spring Statement, which did almost nothing to help Brits who will be clobbered by higher fuel bills when Ofgem raises the energy cap on April . The mum-of-two, who has three jobs, said she was a woman who on paper has a good job and whataposs considered a good salary but rising energy prices has now put an intense strain on my ability to provide for my children. Pleading with him to do more for families, she said: The signicant increase in our energy bills has meant that we donapost have the boiler on. The lights are always off unless absolutely necessary and when itaposs cold, we wear jumpers and coats and sometimes you can see our breaths when we breathe.  Now, despite working a full time job Iaposm having to find ways to bridge the gap. Iaposve started cleaning houses and I spend every evening riding a bike delivering Uber Eats. Iaposve managed to cut my grocery shop down to just £ a week for an adult and two children, and I often go without myself to make sure the kids get what they need and theyaposre fed. Before today, the Chancellor announced all energy customers will get a £ refund on their energy bill later in the year, which will be applied automatically from October.But it led to Mr Sunak being branded the loan shark Chancellor by Labour as the discount will be clawed back will need to be repaid in £ annual instalments, from April  over five years.Millions of Brits will also be eligible for a £ rebate off their council tax bill this year. The council tax rebate will apply to homes in council tax bands A, B, C or D in England and Wales - roughly % of properties - but not those who live in council tax bands E, F, G and H . Hzul told the Chancellor the governmentaposs £ off council tax and £ energy loan to cope with rising energy bills just isnapost going to cut it.  Iaposve just about been able to balance things up until this point, but Iaposm now facing paying out more each month that Iaposm making, Hzul said. What are you going to do to address the soaring cost of energy andyouaposre not doing anything, please me what  do you suggest I can be doing to help myself The Chancellor has been under mounting pressure to help Brits struggling with their energy bills as regulator Ofgem prepares to lt price cap by £ from April .It will mean a % jump most householdsapos bills - which go up from £, to £, - and prepayment customers will be worse off, with a bills hike of £ from £, to £,. Mr Sunak told Hzul: I canapost imagine how dficult your job is, adding he had enormous admiration for what youaposre doing, an it sounds like youaposre working your socks off to look after them, so tribute to you. He admitted there was no further help on offer apart from the council tax rebate and the energy loan, and we would have to seein October energy bills would be raised again. title: tories incapable helping keep families
story: Rishi Sunak has sunk Brits living standards like a PO owner sacking galley slavesTaking more money out of peoples pay packets and bank accounts when prices are rocketing is Rishi Sunak pouring petrol on the cost of living crisisopinionByKevin MaguireAssociate editor:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsWith the insensitivity of a PO owner sacking galley slaves, Rishi Sunakaposs sunk the living standards of British families. Cometh the hour, cometh the blinkered out of touch Chancellor failing to rise to the challenge. Heaposs fiddled while household budgets are burning from searing inflation averaging .% thataposll deliver the worst cut in living standards for more than half a century. Back to the s may prove Sunakaposs prospects of succeeding Boris Johnson are hitting the rocks. Taking more money out of peopleaposs pay packets and bank accounts when prices are rocketing is the Tory Treasury pouring petrol on the cost of living crisis. This Chancellor remains a record tax raiser, upping the National Insurance threshold giving back only a little of the extra £-billion to be grabbed. Reducing fuel duty p might never be felt at the pumps and is a fraction of an increase in the price of a litre since topping p since the start of the year.And that promise of a p Income Tax cut in two years is an election bribe suggesting a contest in Autumn  or Spring . It deserves to be greeted with the same suspicion generated by PO claims the ferry firm obeys the law. The  Conservative Manesto promised NI wouldnapost go up , the pension triple-lock would continue and international aid was protected . The penny off tax also exposes the Tory lie the NI jump is a hypothecated health and social care levy when the switch emphasises itaposs really another tax rise but a little will be ed. Sunak, Johnson and Conservative ideology are the main problem. Not Covid last year, Ukraine this year or next year presumably a big boy with a stick who ran away. The Tories are proving politically, practically and ideologically incapable of helping keep families afloat. Never mind prosper. title: asda branded laughing stock after
story: Asda branded laughing stock after spot prison convict-style clothing rangeSupermarket giant Asda left its shoppers bewildered by a new clothing range which some bemusedly said was reminiscent of prison clothingASDA was branded laughing stock over prison wear clothing Image: George AsdaByLucy WilliamsonReporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsASDA shoppers were puzzled after spotting a clothing range which many branded to be more like something youaposd wear aposin prisonapos. The supermarket posted, on its George at ASDA page, some matching blue couplesapos tracksuits. However, while some commented how cute others compared it to prison unorm, saying Convict style. The blue outfits are available in Unisex sizes, so you can match with your mate or partner. They cost £ each . They also come in white and brown. But one person took aim at the matching outfits: Is this to wear in prison. Its clearly designed on prison inmate clothes, and who in their right minds thinks that people wish to be seen ANYWHERE in matching outfits. I really really have no idea where your buyers and merchandisers get their ideas from. Asda George used to be good, now its becoming a laughing stock TBH. Others slammed: Matching prison wear with your other half. Living the dream. and When you are chilling at pm but back in your cell at ! Crikey.Others, aside from the prison-look, just werenapost pleased with the garment, saying: They have to be joking!, Is that the best clothing theyaposve got at the minute .But not everyone was so negative - with others excited to get their hands on the trackies. Comments included Totally here for these and omg how cute. It seems ASDA shoppers were ided - what do you reckon  Convict costume or lovely loungewear  When contacted, ASDA declined to comment. title: creepy footage abandoned underground tunnel
story: Creepy footage of abandoned underground tunnel been captured by daring explorerCallum Cromwell from Reading shot the forgotten Camdens Rat Hole on his Nikon camera. The tunnel has graffiti-stained walls and echoes of footsteps and passing trains in the abandoned spaceThe abandoned Camden tunnels were originally used to transport horses and pit ponies in the th century.BySamantha Mordi:,  Mar |commentsA photographer who has been exploring London Underground tunnels for six years has captured creepy images of an abandoned station. Callum Cromwell, shot a disused tunnel called aposCamdenaposs Rat Holeapos on his Nikon camera. The -year-old said the scariest moment of the shoot was hearing trains echo throughout the space as he filmed. The only signs of le in the eerily isolated tunnel were the graffiti-stained walls and sounds of footsteps over the rock terrain. Further scenes showed faint torchlight cast over the forgotten tracks. The abandoned Camden tunnels were originally used to transport horses and pit ponies in the th century. The Camden service tunnel cuts underneath the mainline tracks between Euston and Chalk Farm. The tunnel is a place I have been wanting to explore for around five years, but itaposs only recently become accessible again, Callum, who is from Reading said.The tunnel is now sealed though. I found it through doing a bit of research into hidden and disused derelict London underground locations. The tunnel entrance was pretty easy to get into. The place is a huge giant steel tunnel which is over nine-hundred yards long, and the place had a really damp smell to it The only scary moment was hearing the trains on a nearby active track whizzing by and echoing through the tunnel, but thataposs part of the thrill. I have been exploring for six years now and have been going to locations all over the place. Urban exploring is about finding and exploring hidden and disused derelict sites that not many get to see, but there are certain rules which apply to it such as do not break in, do not steal, do not do damage, only take photos and leave footprints. The series of disused tunnels, also known as the Camden Catacombs, were built by Robert Stephenson. In , wine importers W.  A. Gilbey used the network to store alcohol. In recent years, the network of vaults and tunnels are largely submerged due to flooding. This comes after a secret tunnel was discovered in Elstree. Not open to the public, nor is it a fancy escape route for the rich, the monorail is owned by the electricity grid as their inspection railway. Completed in November , the private underground monorail service runs from Elstree to St Johnaposs Wood.The system sits  metres below the ground, and connects two kV substations at each location, Herts Live reported. According to an article written by transport enthusiast IanVisits, the substation was required to keep up with Londonaposs massive demand for power. Construction began in April  for the tunnel, which is three metres wide - not much smaller than a tube tunnel. news uk-news frail-queen-hopes-attend-philip-"Queen is confined to a wheelchair says Christopher BigginsByAntony ThrowerNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsA service giving thanks to the Duke of Edinburgh will have members of the royal family in attendance, it has been confirmed, but did not specythe Queen would be among them.The event, due to be held at Westminster Abbey in honour of Prince Philip who died last April aged , is taking place on Tuesday, March .Today it has been confirmed members of the Royal Family will attend but did not confirm the Queen would be among them. There are fears Her Majesty could miss the event in honour of her husband of more than  years after recent bouts of bad health. A statement read: “Members of the Royal Family will attend a Service of Thanksgiving for the le of HRH The Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh, at Westminster Abbey on Tuesday, th March.  “The Service will give thanks for The Duke of Edinburgh’s dedication to family, Nation and Commonwealth and recognise the importance of his legacy in creating opportunities for young people, promoting environmental stewardship and conservation, and supporting the Armed Forces. “The Service will in particular pay tribute to The Duke of Edinburgh’s contribution to public le and steadfast support for the over  charitable organisations with which His Royal Highness was associated throughout his le.” The Duke of Edinburghaposs Award is expected to feature prominently in next weekaposs service, with a tribute to be given in the abbey by a recipient of the gold award. Other guests include representatives from the Government, the Armed Forces and the Devolved Administrations as well as representatives of Overseas Territories, The Queenaposs Household, the clergy and other faiths. The congregation will have more than  representatives of The Duke of Edinburgh’s patronages and charities. The Queen has already this month missed the Commonwealth Day service, with the decision to cancel her appearance understood to be related to her comfort travelling the -mile journey from Windsor Castle to London. Prince Harry has already confirmed he will not be attending over his security fears.  In a statement Westminster Abbey said: The Duke of Edinburgh had a long association with Westminster Abbey. On th November , he married HRH Princess Elizabeth here , and they celebrated anniversaries including their Silver, Golden and Diamond Wedding anniversaries with services in the Abbey.He was also President and Chairman of the Westminster Abbey Trust, set up in , to raise funds for the restoration of the exterior. For many years His Royal Highness attended the annual Opening of the Field of Remembrance. title: free covid tests scaled back
story: Free Covid tests scaled back as people scramble for free kits before theyre scrappedBrits are being discouraged from ordering packs of free NHS lateral flow tests - with authorities saying most tests are needed for people considered higher riskNHS lateral flow tests are unavailable in many areas of the country Image: AFP via Getty ImagesByMartin BagotHealth and Science editorPickover Ella:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments Free Covid- tests in England are being scaled back as people scramble for free test packs while they are still available. In many areas of the country home delivery of free NHS lateral flow tests are unavailable.People trying to order are discouraged to order packs when they try and access them online. “Most tests are now needed for people at higher risk,” according to the online ordering system.“In England, most people without Covid- symptoms no longer need to take rapid lateral flow tests. “Some people still need tests to stay safe, like: NHS staff people who are at higher risk people who are visiting high-risk places.“We want to make sure tests are available for people who need them most.”  There is still confusion within the NHS as to whether tests will still be free for staff. The NHS Confederation said that workers may be forced to fork out about £ a month for teststhey have to pay themselves, as it called for clarity over the issue. The Department of Health and Social Care said that more details would be set out “shortly”. Free universal testing for the virus will come to an end on April , with free tests only being made available to the most vulnerable. Officials have previously said that the number of free tests available each day will be capped to “manage demand” as the Government scales back free testing for people in England.  The public have been encouraged not to stockpile test packs but since ministers announced the end of the free testing programme for most of the population it has been dficult for many to access them. But the UK Health Security Agencysaid that availability is refreshed regularly. A UKHSA spokesperson said: “As set out in the Living With Covid plan, from April  free tests will only be available for certain groups who are at most risk from the virus.“In preparation for this change, the gov.uk home ordering channel is asking users to only order test kitsyou’re eligible for new Covid- treatments, work or volunteer in a high-risk setting or support people who are at higher risk from Covid-.“Tests should only be ordered after you have used up any kits you already have at home.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON NHSCoronavirus testing" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: kate bought princess charlotte disney
story: Kate bought Princess Charlotte a Disney tiara but she prefers the real dealPrincess Charlotte is said to have made her mother promise to give her a real tiara when shes older after she was previously given a toy Disney version to keep her happyCharlotte is said to have very expensive taste Image: KENSINGTON PALACE AFP via GettyByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Mar |commentsWhen most of us think about what it must be like to grow up as a princess, we think of gorgeous dresses, castles and tiaras - to name a few. But, while the reality of being a princess might be slightly dferent to how itaposs portrayed in a Disney film, that doesnapost stop some of the youngest members of the royal family from wanting it to be exactly that. Princess Charlotte, daughter of the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge, is only six years old, but sheaposs fast becoming a firm favourite among royal fans, thanks to her sassy personality and love of style. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. The young royal is becoming more and more like mum Kate as time goes by, and its claimed she regularly likes to root through her stylish accessories. As well as apparently being obsessed with sunglasses, the princess is also said to have quite a taste for tiaras - and to be honest, we wouldnapost expect anything less.According to Le  Style, Charlotte is very expensive taste and is so desperate to have a tiara of her own that Kate bought her a Disney princess to keep her happy, but she prefers the real deal and made Kate promise to give it to her in the future.The six-year-old, who is said to have been described as the Queenaposs mini me, with her Majesty telling insiders sheaposs confident that her great-granddaughter will grow up to be a great leader and role model. With other insiders previously claiming Charlotte oozes confidence and adores the spotlight thereaposs every chance sheaposll relish becoming a senior figure in the royal family once sheaposs older.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. news uk-news kate-middleton-dazzles-green-gown-"Kate Middleton wears green gown alongside William at state dinnerByRussell MyersRoyal EditorJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsThe Duchess of Cambridge looked dazzling in green as she and Prince William attended the second evening reception of their Caribbean tour.Kate opted for a stunning Jenny Packham off the shoulder ruffle gown for the glittering state dinner at the house of Jamaicaaposs Governor General in Kingston.She paired the dress with emerald and diamond earrings and a bracelet loaned from the Queen, as well as her Royal Family Order and GVCO Star - although there was no tiara. She also wore her hair in a chic updo.William, who gave a speech expressing his “profound sorrow” over the stain of slavery on Britain, also looked suave in black tie. As they arrived and were greeted by the Governor General Patrick Allen, William told them they had a brilliant day in Jamaica.Kate added that she also had a fantastic day and said thank you for having us back again. The couple also walked down a set of stairs in the Governor Generalaposs house that the Queen and Prince Philip walked down in when they visited Jamaica in  - recreating that moment.During his speech, William said he “strongly agreed” with his father Prince Charles’s previous declaration that Britain is forever stained by its role in the global slave trade. He said: “Slavery was abhorrent. And it should never have happened. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up. Meanwhile, those at the dinner, sat down to a menu that included roasted pumpkin and potato soup, pimento-smoked sea bass and suzette fanned crepes.Earlier in the day, Kate looked gorgeous in another outfit - a white trouser suit by McQueen - as she and William met with Jamaica’s Prime Minister Andrew Holness, who made clear his countryaposs intention to break away from the British monarchy.  The royal couple were welcomed to Jamaica House in Kingston by Mr Holness and his we Juliet, and introduced to cabinet members including Marlene Malahoo Forte, Minister for Legal Affairs, Robert Morgan, Minister without Portfolio, Floyd Green, Minister without Portfolio, Office of the Prime Minister and Audrey Sewell, Permanent Secretary, Office of the Prime Minister.After signing the visitors’ book in the lobby, William and Kate were taken inside for a private meeting with Mr Holness, who told the couple: “We are very very happy to have you and I hope you will have seen the warm welcome of the people. “Jamaica is a very free and liberal country and the people are very expressive and I’m certain that you will have seen the spectrum of expression yesterday. “There are issues here which are, as you would know, unresolved, but your presence gives an opportunity for these issues to be placed in context, put front and centre and to be addressed as best we can. “But Jamaica is, as you can see, a country that is very proud of its history, very proud of what we have achieved and we are moving on and we intend to attain, in short order, our developing goals and to fulfil our true ambitions… as an independent, developed, prosperous country.” After they toured a teacher training college and also meet doctors and nurses at a local hospital, before meeting members of the Jamaican Defence Force. title: parents rake 35000 month filming
story: Parents rake in £, a month filming their realistic sex lives and say kids dont mindJess Miller, , and her husband, Mike, , started uploading videos of themselves having sex on Pornhub and Only Fans to earn extra cash and help cover their mortgage repayments.They share their realistic sex le Image: Jess and Mike MillerByRosaleen FentonDeputy Features Editor:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar Two parents have told how they turned into pornstars who share their aposrealisticapos sex le online - and now rake in £k a month. Jess, , and Mike Miller, , from Southend-on-Sea, have been together for  years and started making explicit videos four years ago. They now earn £, a month from Pornhub and Only Fans by sharing their antics online. More than , loyal fans subscribe to their work - and the couple has told their kids after their unusual career became public. Jess and Mike chatted to the TV show Real Fix about the day-to-day le of being pornstars. Jess, a former semi-permanent make-up artist, said: It never gets boring for us.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here  I donapost really feel like weaposre pornstars - as weaposre just doing what we normally would but filming it. A lot of people who watch us say it’s nice to see real love. “We put a camera in the room and people can see what it’s really like when we have sex. Mike, a former personal trainer, said: I get to have sex with my we every day and love le and get paid for it. taposs great and made us stronger as a couple. Mike and Jess first met in August  when he worked as a personal trainer at the gym she attended. After hitting it off they married in June , and had a son, now eight, together as well as bringing up Jessapos daughter, , from a previous relationship. The pair started posting their steamy videos on Pornhub in December . I had seen that Pornhub would pay based on how well your videos did, Mike said. We were struggling to have quality time together because we were stressed with our businesses so I thought this might be a great side hustle for us.As soon as he suggested it, I said yes straight away, Jess added. The couple kept their antics secret at first, but revealed their job to friends and family in February . Mike said: We decided we wouldnapost tell anyone to start with, but it only took a month for someone to find out. Jess said: My friend messaged me askingI was a pornstar and my heart sank as I didnapost know how she knew. So, I told my mum from there and she was really chilled about it. All our families care about is that we are happily married and that we love each other. Eventually, they confessed to their children what they did for a living in . Our eldest knows pretty much everything, Jess said. I ask him what he thinks and he just says: aposItaposs none of my business.apos Mike said: One is too young to fully know what we do, our eldest was very mature and said as long as we are happy and love them then it’s not a problem at all. The couple gets specic requests from subscribers and plan their content each week. Iaposve had someone ask me to dress up as Elsa and play the Frozen song in the background, Jess said. I said no to that one. Weaposve made £ just for a video of us tickling each other. The pair have also started introducing a third girl to their videos. We delved into threesomes recently, Jess said. It was nerve-wracking, but we see it as work and weaposre all professional. The couple said it has also improved their own relationship and brought them closer together. We do get nasty comments online, but it doesnapost affect us, Mike said. Weaposre happy and our kids are happy so thataposs all that matters. Jess said: People like to watch us too because we’re a real couple and tell us it’s even saved their relationship - itaposs done wonders for our relationship too. “It’s brought us closer together and our bond is stronger than itaposs ever been. news uk-news princess-eugenie-shares-rare-photo-"Princess Eugenie shares sweet video of baby August in England baby growByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Mar Princess Eugenie is marking her nd birthday today - and to celebrate the day she has shared a rare family snap showing her baby son August. Eugenie posted the adorable image on her Instagram page to thank those who had sent her birthday wishes. The cute photo shows Eugenie and husband Jack Brooksbank walking with one-year-old son August through a park.Little August holds on to both his parentsapos hands as he toddles across the pavement wearing sweet black and white striped trousers and an orange top. Eugenie captioned the snap: What a birthday to celebrate in the park with my boys. Thank you Xx, followed by a kiss emoji.And royal fans were quick to comment on how much they loved the photo. One wrote: That’s such a beautul photo. Another added: Very precious times. Enjoy. You will make wonderful memories which will stay with you forever. While another said: Beautul photo! Happy Birthday, I’m glad you had a lovely day with your boys.Little August was born last February and is th in line to the throne, with his great grandmother the Queen.  Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up.He was christened last year in a rare royal double christening alongside Zara and Mike Tindallaposs young son Lucas.August and Lucas both share the same middle name of Philip - a tribute to their great-grandfather Prince Philip who died last year shortly after the two boys were born. In a documentary last year, Eugenie revealed August got to meet Philip shortly before his death in April.  Holding back the tears, Eugenie explained: We named August, August Philip because grandpa has been such a huge, inspiring character in my le. I brought little August to come and meet him and told him that we had named him after him and it was such a lovely moment. We were very lucky to do that.  Meanwhile, one member of the royal family who may have sent Eugenie a present today is her cousin Prince Harry. She was the first royal to visit him in the US since he and we Meghan Markle moved there with their children after quitting the Firm two years ago.The royal pair were pictured together in the stands for the Super Bowl last month - although were without Meghan and Jack. Not only is Eugenie the only royal to have met up with Harry in Calornia, she could also be the only member of the family to have met his new baby daughter Lilibet. news uk-news uk-weather-forecast-met-office-"UK weather: Warm and sunny conditions forecast by Met OfficeBySam Elliott-GibbsReporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments Brits will continue to bake in a mini heatwave with temperatures now expected to remain scorching for the start of the weekend. The UK will enjoys warmer weather than Spanish hotspots Marbella and Lanzarote on Thursday with another roasting day ahead. The Met Office is predicting that temperatures could again peak at C on Thursday, for the third day in a row.The south east of England will be the warmest today, with London enjoying the highs at pm this afternoon. After first predicting a wintry weekend, the sun is now expected to shine for many on Saturday before Sunday sees a drop off in the heat.  Cambridgeshire may also see C today and temperatures could peak at C from pm in Liverpool, making it hotter than Barcelona. The warm weather this week is the result of a high pressure system that has moved in from the east and is now settled on the country for the next few days. We were told to enjoy it while we can but now it seems Saturday will also be baking, with C in the south now predicted. However, things could take a massive turn as the UK enters April, with one weather service suggesting lows of -C in Scotland.Parts of Wales instead look set to see temperatures y from C to C while England could see highs of just C in Cornwall. But before the colder conditions do come, March will end with sun almost everywhere. “This settled spell of spring sunshine carries on for the rest of the week and beyond, Met Office forecaster Aidan McGivern said. “With clear skies expected tonight temperatures will fall away and a few mist and fog patches could form in one or two spots.  They will be fairly isolated and most likely in parts of eastern England for example like recent nights with temperatures dipping away as well. A touch of frost in places as we start off Thursday. Frost free Western Isles, parts of Northern Ireland where it will turn cloudier through the night, perhaps one or two showers into the Western Isles.” The UKaposs national weather service said in its long-range forecast: Still settled for many at the start of next week but a trend to showery and colder conditions is expected to take place from the north from Monday.  “Showers will likely be focused on northern and eastern areas, potentially wintry over northern hills and at lower levels in the far northeast. “A good deal of dry weather persisting in the south and west. Potential for strong winds in the far northeast early in the period. “Later next week and beyond, more unsettled conditions are likely with more frequent showers or longer spells of rain for many areas. “After a spell of below average temperatures next week, temperatures are likely toto near average later in the period.” Friday: Again dry and warm with sunny spells for many although cloudier in the far northwest. One or two isolated afternoon showers may develop across northern England and southeastern Northern Ireland. Outlook for Saturday to Monday: Mainly settled with light winds and warm sunny spells cloudier in the far north with occasional light rain. Early mist fog patches in places, clearning inland but lingering near some coasts. title: uk weather forecast sweltering 20c
story: UK weather forecast: Sweltering C high today and hot flush all the way to weekendThe Met Office is predicting that temperatures could again peak at C on Thursday, for the third day in a row, making the country hotter than Spanish holiday island LanzaroteTemperatures are expected to reach C again on Thursday Image: Liverpool EchoByTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Mar |comments Brits are set to bask in a third straight day of C temperatures on Thursday and the scorching weather is expected to carry on into the weekend.After an icy start to March, spring has clearly arrived with sunshine and blue skies up and down the country.Once again the mercury hit C on Wednesday and the hotter than average temperatures are expected to continue for the coming days with the Met Office estimating they are as much as C above the norm for the time of year.The sunshine is thanks to a high pressure system that is sitting over the UK having moved in from the continent giving the country temperatures higher than many southern European holiday hotspots. On Thursday more C heat means that the UK will be warmer than the Spanish holiday island of Lanzarote. Like Wednesday the day will start cold before the sunshine arrives.  “This settled spell of spring sunshine carries on for the rest of the week and beyond, Met Office forecaster Aidan McGivern said. “With clear skies expected tonight temperatures will fall away and a few mist and fog patches could form in one or two spots. They will be fairly isolated and most likely in parts of eastern England for example like recent nights with temperatures dipping away as well. A touch of frost in places as we start off Thursday. Frost free Western Isles, parts of Northern Ireland where it will turn cloudier through the night, perhaps one or two showers into the Western Isles.” Air from the Atlantic is bringing cloudier skies for the north west of Scotland and spots of rain but the high pressure is dominant over the UK meaning warm weather for most.  Mr McGivern continued: On the whole after a chilly start. Much of the UK still basking in that warm March sunshine and temperatures similar across England and Wales to recent days C to C, could squeeze a C in Cambridgeshire for example. Then for Friday there is more of the same eventemperatures are fractionally lower. “Plenty more, well, fine weather to come ... blue skies across the board virtually just one exception there for Shetland, Orkney, thicker clouds, a few drizzly showers at time but where largely dry, said Mr McGivern. For the vast majority dry once againand those temperatures are responding. Technically down a degree or so compared to the last couple of days but with light winds and sunshine I doubt it will be that noticeable. And really those temperatures in place are C perhaps C above average so very warm for the time of year. UK forecast for the next  days Rather cloudy in the northwest, where mostly dry and sunny Today: Early fog patches quickly clearing to leave another warm day with plenty of sunshine for most. Very isolated afternoon showers may develop in the north, more likely over eastern Scotland. Cloudier in the northwest with some light rain at times. Tonight: Rather cloudy for parts of Scotland and Northern Ireland, especially the far north and northwest where a little light rain. Clear where with patchy frost and a few fog patches. Friday: Again dry and warm with sunny spells for many although cloudier in the far northwest. One or two isolated afternoon showers may develop across northern England and southeastern Northern Ireland. Outlook for Saturday to Monday: Mainly settled with light winds and warm sunny spells cloudier in the far north with occasional light rain. Early mist fog patches in places, clearning inland but lingering near some coasts. title: aspiring model 20 dubbed a
story: Double jabbed aspiring model, , loses BOTH legs in harrowing Covid battleClaire Bridges from Tampa, Florida, who was born with a congenital heart condition, was also diagnosed with myocarditis, rhabdomyolysis, mild pneumonia, cyanosis and acidosisClaire Bridges lost her legs due to complications from Covid-ByCarly BassSamantha Mordi:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments An aspiring model has been dubbed a warrior by her family after losing both her legs from Covid- complications.Claire Bridges had several emergency operations and a stint on le support, but sadly her legs still couldnapost be saved after they suffered irreversible muscle damage. The -year-old, from Tampa, Florida, was admitted to Tampa General hospital in January this year and her condition started to deteriorate rapidly over a two week period due to organ failure.Claire, who was born with a congenital heart condition, was also diagnosed with myocarditis, rhabdomyolysis, mild pneumonia, cyanosis and acidosis, Yahoo News reports.She was given a TandemHeart – which helps to send a steady supply of oxygenated blood to organs – and hours after that was placed on continuous dialysis because of her failing kidneys. As the complications worsened, so did the condition in her leg so doctors performed a fasciotomy to relieve the swelling and pressure. Despite trying to save her legs, the damage was too severe and irreversible, her dad Wayne Bridges revealed. In February Ms Bridges, who is vaccinated, had both legs cut off above the knee. She wasnapost getting circulation to her legs and, because of that, there was a lot of muscle damage, her best friend Heather Valdes told WTVT, Newsweek reported. Doctors also discovered she was bleeding internally resulting in an emergency blood transfusion.They found a very rare lesion in the first part of the small intestines that had ruptured, her dad revealed on Facebook. Luckily they were able to fix it and stop the bleeding. Despite the le-changing event, Ms Bridges remained positive according to family and friends who described her as an amazing young woman and a warrior. Her dad Wayne has detailed his daughteraposs journey on Facebook and revealed on March  that she was finally able to sit up herself for the first time since January. Two months to the day this all started and Claire, for the first time sat up by herself, he wrote on Facebook. It may not seem like a lot, but for this Warrior itaposs a major victory! And for this victory, it looks like our Warrior girl is coming home to her momaposs house today for the rehab phase of her journey. This week, Claire was released from hospital in time for her st birthday. She is very happy to be home around family and friends, Mr Bridges told Newsweek. Itaposs been mentally, emotionally taxing but weaposre hopeful now. She is still facing more challenges but we are focused on having her home. Mr Bridges said his daughter will require ongoing rehab with physical and occupational therapy. She will also need to prepare for prosthetic legs. Mr Bridges set up a GoFundMe page for his daughter with hopes to raise £, which will go towards Claireaposs medical and ongoing recovery expenses. I am so proud of you and inspired by you. You have overcome more in two months than any of us could imagine in a letime, Mr Bridges wrote in a touching tribute on Facebook. You will be climbing again before you know it. title: boy 12 girl 14 armed
story: Boy, , and girl, , armed with AK- held  minute gunfight with copsTravis O’Brien and Nicole Jackson, were aged  and , when they fired at police in a  minute shoot-out in Volusia County, Florida. OBrien has now been sentenced to a juvenile facilityTravis O’Brien, now , has been sentenced to a juvenile facilityByTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Mar A -year-old boy and a -year-old pal armed with an AK- held a  minute shoot-out with police in Florida. Travis O’Brien, now , has been sentenced to a juvenile facility after firing at police in June last year along with his teen accomplice Nicole Jackson. The pair had broken out of a local children’s home and had entered a house in Volusia County when the gun fight started.Defence lawyer Jeff Deen told WESH-TV : “He’s a little tiny, little boy and he got into a big mess.“He wasn’t in control of his situation and he can’t understand some of the things that we understand.” The youngster pleaded no contest to charges of burglary, criminal mischief and attempted murder of law enforcement officers, and was remanded to a maximum-risk assessment programme followed by a conditional release.  The “Bonnie and Clyde” duo had escaped from Florida United Methodist Children’s Home and were hiding in an empty home in nearby Enterprise on June . Police arrived after reports of a break-in at the property and began to be fired at by the two children. The gun battle continued for  minutes with an officer heard saying on a viral video at one point that Jackson was “re-racking”. The officer said: “Female has a shotgun in her hand, stand by.” He is then heard shouting “put the gun down now” and then shooting can be heard.  “They’re shooting on me,” the officer then said. “Hold the air. I’m code . She’s re-racking a round inside the shotgun.” The dispatcher replies: “Let’s not engage them anymore. “Let’s not challenge them.” But the officer said: “She’s racked a round in the shotgun. The window’s busted on the patio side. If she comes out she’s going to have the shotgun.” Then moments later Jackson came out of the house with gun and was shot - with her screams heard in video footage. “I think the female’s down,” an officer said. “Call in the units. Female’s on the ground behind the car.”  The footage then shows the boy surrendering and being taken into custody. Jackson was taken to hospital with le threatening injuries after being shot in the chest and arm but she recovered after surgery. She is yet to be sentenced for her involvement in the incident. Meanwhile, a couple, Shauna and Dan Willis, have reportedly offered to adopt Jackson after talking to her by phone from her jail.“We just have good intentions in mind for her. So, we pray for her every day, andwe can give her a family, we’d be willing to do that,” Shauna Willis told WNDU.Read MoreRead More Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON PoliceCrimeBurglary" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news us-news terrying-moment-two-men-seen-"Cat savagely attacked by two dogs spurred on by ownersBySam TrueloveNews reporter:,  Mar |commentsA shocking video has captured the shocking moment two dog owners encourage their pets to maul a family cat. The home video footage shows the two heartless dog owners allow their pets to freely attack the cat, named Buddy, who was sitting on the porch. The men can be heard shouting get him and good boy while the dogs attack the cat. Moments beforehand, the two men could be seen on camera with their dogs walking past the home, before stopping after noticing the cat. The horric attack lasts  seconds before a homeowner comes out to try and save the cat.  Someone can be heard shouting no, while Buddy is clearly in discomfort. Pennsylvania SPCA are investigating the attack, which happened in Frankford, Philadelphia on Tuesday morning. The Pennsylvania SPCA is asking for the public’s help identying two iniduals who appear to be responsible for an intentional dog attack on a family’s cat in the city’s Frankford neighbourhood this morning, Pennsylvania SPCA said in a statement.  The video shows two iniduals walking two dogs passed a family home on Granite Street. On the video it appears that an inidual spots the cat named Buddy on a porch, comes back and releases one dog on the cat followed by a second dog. As the attack continued, a person or persons can be heard on the video encouraging the dogs to continue attacking the cat until a resident of the property comes out to intervene on behalf of the cat. Buddy sustained le-threatening injuries and was transported to the PSPCA.  In an update posted on Wednesday, Pennsylvania SPCA said Buddy had been sent to an ER vet to be closely monitored. He made it through the night. He continues to be in extremely critical condition. We arecautiously optimistic, the update said. Pennsylvania SPCA have now released pictures of two men they wish to identy in connection with the attack. Anyone with information is urged to contact the PSPCAaposs cruelty hotline -- or cruelty@pspca.org. Tips can be left anonymously. title: ive made 100000 taking lateral
story: Exclusive: Ive made £, taking lateral flow tests on camera - my fans love itKitty, who is an adult performer on  Fanvue, says shes been bombarded with requests from fans to take lateral flow tests on camera - and they get weirder every timeKitty claims she has been paid £, in total to take LFTs on cameraByJessica TaylorReal Le Features Writer:,  Mar |commentsAn adult performer who has a channel on an adult streaming  says sheaposs made £, taking Covid tests on camera. Redhead beauty Kitty, who has thousands of subscribers on  Fanvue - which is attempting to rival OnlyFans - says her viewers love watching her take lateral flow tests. She now reckons sheaposs a pro at taking the tests, which can often make your eyes water, without flinching at all. Kitty, who says she finds her Fanvue account empowering, says she first set it up so she could make money from everything she posted - seeing as she was posting on social media a lot anyway. For more of the news you care about straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here Iaposve made thousands from my lateral flow tests content alone, she told The Mirror. You have to put the work in but Iaposve built up a loyal fan base who keep coming back for more. While she posts a lot of content on her feed, Kitty says she most enjoys the private chats with her top fans, which are where all the fun happens. She said: I’ve been asked to sell used panties to people, to send spit, and one day someone even asked me for a used lateral flow test.  Since she received the first request for an LFT, Kitty realised sheaposd found a gap in the market and she was soon bombarded with requests.I’ve been asked to drizzle the buffer and swab places I don’t think I can even say out loud, she said.Kitty has now taken hundreds of lateral flow tests on camera at the request of her fans.She said: Itaposs been drilled into us to test regularly so I’ve been a good girl and have been doing as I was told.People just like to watch me do them, and I’m happy to give them what they want. She added that, while some might criticise her for taking so many tests when she doesnapost have Covid, she thinks sheaposs being responsible by reminding people to test regularly while cases rise once more. Kitty asked: That can only be a good thing, right She added: The NHS have done an amazing job, and supporting their work is really important to me.For each lateral flow video request, I’m also donating a percentage of earns to NHS charities so they can keep up all their great work. title: lad roasts pals abysmal dinners
story: Lad roasts pals abysmal dinners his mum lovingly makes - as some are unidentiableClem Johnson regularly shares pictures of his dinner with his friends but the meals are roasted by his friend Owen Southwood - who says some are unidentiablePie and crackers was one of the worst dishes on the list Image: Kennedy News and MediaByZahna EklundAudience writerSophie Norris:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments A lad who shares pictures of the meals his mum lovingly cooks for him with his friends in a group chat has seen the dinners mercilessly mocked online after one of his pals started a thread on Twitter just to review the abysmal dishes. Clem Johnson, , first started sharing the pictures of his mumaposs cooking with his mates as a laugh as he found himself constantly being served bizarre dinners such as microwaved bacon, pie with cream crackers, and spaghetti with ketchup. The Liverpool season ticket holder often joked to his pals that some of the meals were unidentiable, and his friends would get involved with the banter, as one even said his dinner looked like it had been cooked in a washing machine. Clemaposs friend Owen Southwood, , was so stunned by the array of strange dishes his mate was eating that he just had to share it with the world - and posted hilarious reviews of the dishes on Twitter.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. The thread attracted more than , likes and , retweets, and Owen admitted the pie and crackers dish was among the worst heaposd ever seen. He said: He’s taking the p**s [out of the meals] with most of the pictures. I think he doesn’t mind the spaghetti and sausages but for the rest of them, he’s taking the p**s. We all just send our food in whenever we make something that looks nice, so he does the opposite. It started about two months ago with the sausages and spaghetti. His mum cooks the majority of them. Some of them caused more of a stir in the group than others.  The best-looking one is probably the curry - it looks edible and would probably taste okay. The worst one was the spaghetti with egg and bacon. We voted as a group that it was the worst meal we’d ever seen. The egg and chips weren’t even that bad really - it’s just the presentation. The pie on crackers got called worse than rations. And Clem says he lets his mum cook the dinners as he hates cooking, but he loves seeing the reaction of horried people online. He explained: Iaposve been sending them in for ages as a laugh to see their reaction. I hate cooking it’s just too much effort for five minutes to eat. I live with my mum so she cooks.  Owen said aposenoughaposs enough - it’s going on Twitterapos. All my mates have been laughing for ages. I didn’t think it’d go viral on Twitter though. The reaction onlineaposs been funny. At first, I tried to keep it anonymous but loads of people worked out it was me. I reckon chip and eggs isn’t even that bad. Pie and crackers were definitely a low. I saw that a lad donated £ to a food bank, so that’s all that matters. I don’t go hungry so all good. One of Owenaposs Twitter reviews read: Without doubt the single worst meal I have EVER seen consumed, there are starving refugees who would turn their nose up at this, the bacon was also cooked in the microwave.   While another said: This is supposed to be a fajita, the block of what looks like butter is a solid block of cheese and yes they are baked beans. .  And although Clem is in on the joke, he also took to Twitter to encourage those who laugh at his scran to do what they can to donate to food banks. He tweeted: Now youaposve all had your laugh, can I be serious  Ye my scranaposs s**t, but I’ve got something on my plate. Loads of people don’t. Put your money where your mouth is and support your local foodbank which you can find here.Do you have a story to sell  Get in touch with us at yourmirror@trinitymirror .Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON FoodUmm what Funny tweets" data-immediate"data-immediate"Serve the food you really want to eat by signing up for our tips and recipes and never be bored by your cooking againSign UpInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you.
